item.title: Webclient tut, Not for PI
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Sparta I Am Sparta
item.description:
@I_Am_Sparta wrote:

Kidpaparoach:

Just saying 000webhosts don’t allow gaming clients according to their ToS, if you use vB or gaming client’s on their free package they have the right to delete your account with no prior warning if they get a report. If your going to use them keep regular backups up your forums (I used to use them but recently upgraded)

Yea, I suggest people use webs cuz now you dont have to use the gay webs site builder you can just upload your files

item.title: Webclient tut, Not for PI
item.dc:creator: @mawang mawang
item.description:
@mawang wrote:

I know exactly why this tutorial is so much better than the others.[quote=“Lollyback, post:22, topic:380099”]Step 7:
In your client search for:
Quote

  1. “./cache/”

  2. “./Files/”

  3. “./anim/”

  4. “./models/”

  5. “./Sprites/”

  6. In the java files that have “./cache/” replace “./cache/” with “C:/ServerName/”

  7. In the java files that have “./Files/” replace “./Files/” with “C:/ServerName/Files/”

  8. In the java files that have “./anim/” replace “./anim/” with “C:/ServerName/anim/”

  9. In the java files that have “./models/” replace “./models/” with “C:/ServerName/models/”

  10. In the java files that have “./Sprites/” replace “./Sprites/” with “C:/ServerName/Sprites/”[/quote]

What usually happens is people only find the stuff above in a single file, Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java I believe, and they think that this is all that is needed. HOWEVER. You tell them to search everywhere in the client for those key phrases. This not only prevents the connection error most people get, but it also makes tons of sense lol. Way to go! I am currently in the process of figuring this out using your tutorial, so I am hoping you are my final tutorial to look up. Wish me luck!

-mawang

Read full topic
